creator: apache.org@schildbach.de
text:
The jar task ignores a given manifest file and uses the default one instead. 
However, the existance of the given manifest file _is_ checked.

This bug is not present on Ant 1.3.

Example:

<target name="test2" depends="compile">
	<jar
		jarfile="test2.jar"
		manifest="src/etc/MANIFEST.MF"
	/>
</target>

Please tell me HOW it ignores the manifest. There is a bug, which I have fixed, 
whereby the first line of the manifest is ignored. Can you try putting a 
Manifest-Version line in there to test that.
creator: conor@apache.org
apache.org@schildbach.de
text:
This is very much possible. The manifest that I used consists only of one 
line "Main-Class: test". I added a "Manifest-Version: 1.0" line, and voila: it 
works.
OK good - that has been fixed
creator: conor@apache.org
